b0p6b.question: What condition causes an Amber IAS DISAGREE alert to appear at the bottom of the speed tape?

options.text: V Ref has not been entered
Difference of more than 10 kts for more than 10 seconds between Captain's and First Officer's airspeed indications.
Captain's and First Officer's airspeeds disagree by more than 5 kts for more than 5 seconds.
Selected V Ref is not correct for current aircraft configuration.

fedklj.question: What does the top of the amber bar indicate at the lower end of the speed tape?

options.text: Minimum manoeuvre speed (1.3g manoeuvre capability to stick shaker below approximately 20,000 feet) - (1.3g manoeuvre capability to low speed buffet above approximately 20,000 feet).
Minimum manoeuvre speed (1.3g manoeuvre capability to stick shaker above approximately 30,000 feet) - (1.3g manoeuvre capability to low speed buffet below approximately 30,000 feet).
Minimum manoeuvre speed (1.3g manoeuvre capability to stick shaker above approximately 20,000 feet) - (1.3g manoeuvre capability to low speed buffet below approximately 20,000 feet).
Minimum manoeuvre speed (1.3g manoeuvre capability to stick shaker below approximately 30,000 feet) - (1.3g manoeuvre capability to low speed buffet above approximately 30,000 feet).

a2k43.question: What does a white CDS MAINT message in the lower left corner of the PFD indicate?

options.text: A non-dispatchable CDS fault has occurred post second engine start.
A dispatchable CDS fault has occurred prior to first engine start.
A non-dispatchable CDS fault has occurred prior to second engine start
A dispatchable CDS fault has occurred prior to second engine start.

pmjw5.question: What does the Magenta figure displayed above the Speed Tape signify?

options.text: FMC computed airspeed if the IAS/MACH window is blank.
Airspeed manually selected in the IAS/MACH window.
Current or next speed restriction in the FMC.
Airspeed manually selected in the IAS/MACH window and FMC computed airspeed if the IAS/MACH window is blank.

abfnk.question: On the PFD, what does the amber annunciation "DISPLAYS CONTROL PANEL" indicate?

options.text: The PFD the annunciation is displayed on has an error and information displayed may be erroneous.
The Displays Source Control Panel on the side the annunciation is displayed has failed.
The EFIS control panel on the side the annunciation is displayed has failed
The Display Select Panel on the the side the annunciation is displayed has failed.

xpgftf.question: The amber annunciation "INSTR SWITCH" indicates what?

options.text: The IRS switch on the Forward Overhead panel is not selected to NORMAL
Captain's and First Officer's displays are using separate sources of IRU data.
The IRS switch on the Aft Overhead panel is not selected to NORMAL.
Captain's and First Officer's displays are using the same source of IRU data with the IRS switch selected to OFF.

10ig9.question: On the navigation display, how is the display presented in VOR, Approach and Plan modes?

options.text: VOR = heading up, Approach = heading up, Plan = true north up.
VOR = heading up, Approach = true north up, Plan = heading up.
VOR = true north up, Approach = heading up, Plan = heading up.
VOR = true north up, Approach = true north up, Plan = heading up.

1j9fb.question: The bug below that indicates V2 + 15 is displayed at what stage of flight, and when is it removed?

options.text: Displayed at Takeoff, removed at first flap retraction or when Vref entered in CDU.
Displayed at takeoff, removed when Pitch Flight director moves to 15 degrees nose up.
Displayed at Approach, removed when flaps at Flap 1 or greater.
Displayed on Approach, removed once right main landing gear is compressed, throttle levers at Idle, and engines have spooled down from Approach Idle to Ground Idle.
